intro: Hemidictyum douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's hemidictyum, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is notable for its unique morphology and is considered an indicator species for healthy, undisturbed ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is also listed as endangered in some regions.
